programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Qui単ones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: Episode 3
programme.desc: An amateur takes on the biggest names in poker in a high stakes cash game in Las Vegas. This week, a new rivalry emerges, as Lex Veldhuis and Alan Keating compete for a pot worth more than a quarter of a million dollars.

programme.title: Episode 4
programme.desc: The high stakes cash game continues in Las Vegas, with more than a million dollars now on the table. Entrepreneur Alan Keating continues to drive the action, determined to play every single hand, and make big moves.

programme.title: Episode 5
programme.desc: It's the final session of this high stakes game in Vegas, and the last chance for the amateur Loose Cannon to make a profit. Meanwhile, Hollywood actors Arden Cho and Jennifer Tilly play a hand worth $400,000.

programme.title: Episode 6
programme.desc: A fresh cast of characters take their seats in Las Vegas for a high stakes cash game, including poker pros Phil Laak and Maria Ho, actor-writer-comedian Michael Ian Black, and an amateur player a new Loose Cannon looking to make more than just memories.

programme.desc: A couple moves with their daughter back to Atlanta, their hometown. They remember exactly why they left when an old flame and family issues resurface.

programme.title: The Perfect Wife
programme.desc: Following a car crash that claimed her brothers life, a woman marries the man she blames for the accident only to make his life a living hell.

programme.title: My Man

When Trina crosses a line, she becomes the target of a deadly game of cat and mouse. Betrayal, madness, and murder ensue as the lines between love, obsession, and survival blur.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.desc: When his daughter dies, an elderly rancher sends for her child, whom he plans to make his heir.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene investigates Dan, who is believed to be innocent.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene learns that a convicted embezzler has escaped from jail. The thief accuses his partner of double crossing him, and Gene intervenes to see that justice is done.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene inherits half of the Lazy L Ranch from his uncle, but is attacked by masked men on his way to see it. When he learns that the owner of the other half plans to sell, Gene suspects a plot.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene's sheriff friend asks the cowboy to pose as a music teacher to trap a counterfeiting gang.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Champion's uncanny intelligence proves vital in bringing to justice an evildoer.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: When Pat inherits a stage line from a distant relative, he and Gene become involved in a long-standing feud along with Pat's relatives.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Sheriff Gene is up against a newspaperman who prints headlines reporting crimes before they are committed.

programme.title: The Over-the-Hill Gang
programme.desc: A retired Texas Ranger and his three aging pals set out to clean up a lawless town and remove its evil, corrupt mayor from office.

programme.title: Rock Island Trail
programme.desc: Constance Strong (Adele Mara) arrives at Rock Island for the competition between a railroad line, a steamboat and a stagecoach for a profitable mail contract. Constance befriends Reed Loomis (Forrest Tucker), the head of the rail line, but is engaged to Kirby Morrow (Bruce Cabot), the owner of the steamboat. After the rail line easily wins the competition, the rivalry between Loomis and Morrow continues, and Morrow grows to resent his loss of the contract and, apparently, Constance.

programme.title: Escape From Fort Bravo
programme.desc: Captain Roper (William Holden) is the warden of a Union-run prison camp. A mysterious woman named Carla Forester (Eleanor Parker) arrives at the camp in order to free the Confederate prisoners, and things get complicated when Carla and the captain begin to fall for each other. In an effort to recapture the escaped prisoners, Roper has a run-in with a group of Mescalero Indians. In order to survive, he has to team up with his own prisoners to fight the Indians and wipe them out.

programme.title: Thunder Over the Plains
programme.desc: It's the late 1860s, and the U.S. government has yet to reclaim Texas as a state. A group of opportunistic and amoral Northerners head south to claim the territory as their own. Though Texas lawman Capt. Porter (Randolph Scott) believes it's his duty to honor the local leaders, he can't ignore the corruption of the Yankee politicians who are giving him orders. When Confederate veteren Ben (Charles McGraw) is unjustly sentenced to death, Porter decides he has had enough of his new bosses.

programme.title: The Boy From Oklahoma
programme.desc: An Old West law student (Will Rogers Jr.) turns unarmed sheriff, woos a girl (Nancy Olson) and lassos bad guys.

programme.title: Wagon Master
programme.desc: To survive a perilous crossing of the vast Utah desert, a band of Mormons must learn to collaborate with the people they meet on the trail.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Jim Kipp (Randolph Scott) is a bounty hunter hired to find three robbers who committed a daring heist three years ago. When he arrives in a small town near the robbery, he senses that the thieves may be living there. However, many of the townspeople -- including Dr. Spencer (Harry Antrim), his daughter, Julie (Dolores Dorn), and barmaid Alice (Marie Windsor) -- are put on edge by Kipp's presence and want him gone. Kipp perseveres, hatching a plan that he thinks will draw out the bandits.

programme.title: Seven Men From Now
programme.desc: A rancher (Randolph Scott) hunts down those responsible for killing his wife during a Wells Fargo holdup.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: Westward Ho the Wagons!
programme.desc: Based on Mary Jane Carr's novel of the perils and hardships endured by pioneers traversing the Oregon Trail.

programme.title: The Great Locomotive Chase
programme.desc: It's the Civil War, and Union spy James J. Andrews (Fess Parker) is on a top-secret mission: to steal a Confederate train outside of Atlanta and take it back to Union territory in Tennessee, using it to sabotage and destroy Confederate supply routes along the way. But the train's conductor (Jeffrey Hunter) is on to Andrews and is determined to try his best to throw a wrench in the Union spy's plans before he delivers the train to his fellow soldiers.

programme.title: Ride the High Country
programme.desc: Reduced to transporting gold from a distant mine to a small-town bank, retired lawman Steve Judd (Joel McCrea) recruits friend Gil Westrum (Randolph Scott), who has been performing in a traveling carnival. Unknown to Steve, the restless Gil and a young drifter intend to steal the next gold transport. On the way, the men help Elsa Knudsen (Mariette Hartley) to break free from her zealot father and join her fiance at the mine, not realizing the consequences that await them all.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: The Cisco Kid and his English-mangling sidekick Pancho travel the old west in the grand tradition of the Lone Ranger, righting wrongs and fighting injustice wherever they find it.

programme.title: Stories of the Century

programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackies faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlenes thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dans ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: "Gamera" (1966) Science fiction. Only Plan Z can stop a giant, fire-breathing flying turtle roused by an atomic bomb. With Eiji Funakoshi, Harumi Kiritachi, Junichiro Yamashita.

programme.desc: "The Corpse Vanishes" (1942) Horror. A mad botanist drains kidnapped brides to keep his 80-year-old wife looking young. With Bela Lugosi, Luana Walters, Elizabeth Russell.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam Gods Gift Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isnt enough for you then youll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. First up is Mayfair, with a prime location on the busy seafront in Fuengirola, Costa del Sol. The restaurant was set up 28 years ago by 68 year old Londoner Pat and her husband of 45 years, Jack. The good news is that Fuengirola is one of the only towns in Spain that has actually seen an increase in tourists since the recession with 1 and half million Brits visiting last year alone; the bad news is that Mayfair isn't benefitting. With thousands of hungry sun seekers right on its doorstep, the restaurant should be raking it in - but the place is totally empty.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode two sees Gordon tackle struggling Le Deck restaurant in Capbreton, a popular coastal town in South West France. British owners Tim and Debbie emigrated to France 28 years ago, where they met as holiday reps. Since then they've poured blood, sweat and tears into opening 3 ski restaurants in the Alps. With the arrival of their children, they set up home by the coast to enjoy the summer months together as a family. But unable to sit still, Tim launched Le Deck three years ago. Far from being a hobby, the restaurant has taken over his life.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: S02:E02 - Cambodia

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: S02:E03 - Malaysia

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Hellebores, the jewels of the early spring border, come under the spotlight on this show. Monty Don shares his top tips on how to get the best from them. Carol Klein visits a couple who have just moved into a bungalow with a badly neglected garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explains why he thinks that the once-popular chrysanthemum is worth revisiting and Joe Swift has some helpful suggestions if you're thinking of giving your garden a bit of a spring revamp.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants up a new bed of asparagus and shows us how to lift and divide hostas. On our second visit to South Africa, we explore the conditions that allow agapanthus to thrive in the wild.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don breaks ground for his new pond and Carol Klein pays Geoff and Sally Davis another visit in their Somerset garden. Their overgrown shrubs are in need of a jolly good haircut, but they haven't a clue where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the weather begins to warm up, there's plenty to be getting on with in the garden. Monty Don welcomes us to Longmeadow and cracks on with some timely tasks. Including Water Iris Garden, Peonies, Seaside Garden, National Gardening Week.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Magnolias are the showstoppers of the tree world right now and to celebrate them in all their glory, James Alexander-Sinclair pays Borde Hill Garden in West Sussex, with its collection of magnificent champion trees, a visit.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Everything in the garden is shooting up so it's time to lift and divide perennials and Monty is doing just that with his ornamental grasses. In our third trip to South Africa, we discover where red hot pokers grow in the wild.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty's wildlife garden begins to take shape at Longmeadow, bees are very much at the forefront of his mind. He plants up a nectar-rich border that will attract all sorts of bees and other pollinating insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As summer unfolds at Longmeadow, Monty Don undertakes timely tasks in his vegetable garden and flower beds. Meanwhile, Carol Klein enjoys the beauty of one of our unsung native flowers, the geum, and visits a cottage garden which holds the national collection of cultivated forms. Plus, Formula 1 supremo Sir Frank Williams explains why he is opening his garden at Inholmes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As usual, Monty is at Longmeadow where he will set out his plans for the coming year. Monty reviews the effects the winter weather has had on his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the height of summer it's time to ensure that fruits and vegetables are given attention to ensure maximum cropping. Monty gives advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as showing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants which will carry on flowering into Autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the hanging basket season well and truly underway, Joe Swift meets a florist in Surrey who has perfected the art of kokedama, a modern take on the hanging basket. Houseplants come under the spotlight too.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For the National Gardens Scheme, over 400 gardens in England and Wales will be opening to the public. Carol Klein visits one of them as they prepare for the big event. At Longmeadow a local beekeeper arrives with a swarm for Monty's new hive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift continues his quest to find the perfect hanging basket and comes up with his own design for a shady part of his garden. Monty Don has caught the bug too and demonstrates how to plant up an edible basket.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don celebrates the arrival of summer by making a start on his new scented border, and offers a few suggestions for what to be getting on with this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Plants that have a head for heights come under the spotlight. At Craigieburn Garden in the Scottish Borders there is a unique collection of Himalayan plants, plus a look at a nurseryman in Hebden Bridge who has been growing alpines since he was a teenager.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein continues her journey across the nation in search of amazing plant combinations. This week, she's at Logan Botanic Garden near Stranraer famed for its colourful, exotic borders. Joe Swift drops in on a street in Bristol as the residents prepare to be judged by RHS Britain in Bloom.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the holiday season well and truly upon us, Monty shares some timely tips on how to make sure your garden doesn't suffer while you are away. But there are some gardeners that daren't leave home, as Joe Swift discovered when he met Phillip Vowles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don's box hedges are still riddled with blight, so it's time to call in an expert to decide on the next course of action. He also has a go at growing some mushrooms in the hope of picking a bumper crop in the autumn. Meanwhile, Rachel de Thame visits the garden at Highclere Castle in Berkshire - the filming location for Downton Abbey.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein catches up with Geoff and Sally Davis to see how their garden renovation project is coming along. And Monty Don is at Longmeadow enjoying the fruits of his labour, with plenty of seasonal advice in store.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and Carol Klein go behind the scenes at the Malvern Spring Gardening Show. While Monty takes a sneak peak at the floral marquee before the show opens, Carol hunts for rare and unusual plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the height of summer it's time to ensure that fruits and vegetables are given attention to ensure maximum cropping. Monty gives advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as showing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants which will carry on flowering into Autumn.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about plants for free at Longmeadow this week as Monty adds self-sown ornamental grass seedlings to the paradise garden. He also divides ferns for planting elsewhere in the garden. Advolly Richmond explores the history of lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles seasonal jobs at Longmeadow and plants clematis in his cottage garden. Rachel de Thame takes a walk down memory lane when she visits the world's biggest flower garden in Holland and Carol Klein is on the trail of early plant hunters, responsible for the glorious selection of magnolias brought to these shores.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty is planning for next summer by sowing a batch of sweet peas. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is amongst the leaves, bark and berries at Thorp Perrow Arboretum in Yorkshire admiring the onset of the autumn display. Plus, there's a visit to Ryton Gardens in Warwickshire to find out about their collection of heritage vegetables and how to collect their seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Bank Holiday weekend and there's plenty to be getting on with in the garden. Monty Don takes stock of what's worked and what hasn't at Longmeadow, with a view to planning ahead to the autumn. Meanwhile, James Wong goes behind the scenes at Bristol Zoo to find out more about how the animals are kept fed throughout the year.

programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives Ferrari's new V12-powered SUV in the mountains of northern Italy to try to decipher exactly what the Purosangue is all about.Next, Henry reviews the new Ferrari Roma Spider.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen
programme.desc: Hong Kong's underground car scene.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Wild Ferrari Restomod and the Oft-forgotten TVR Tuscan
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the gorgeous RML SWB Ferrari 250 GT restomod before jumping into an amazing car that most people may not be familiar with: the TVR Tuscan.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded pain on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Modern-day California Hot Rods
programme.desc: Matt Farah explores the world of California-legal engine swaps and what they entail.Then, since EVs don't have to worry about emissions at all, Matt explores the new world of modifying Teslas for track-day performance.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ultimate BMW barn find, and a family feud over a "secret Chevy"
programme.desc: A Triumph Stag on a dead end road that leads Tom to a treasure trove of forgotten vacation cars hidden in 100-year-old barns. Next, we get the story of a family feud that caused a classic Chevy to be hidden away for decades.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lamborghini kit car and basement full of cool cars
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds some interesting cars in the basement of a large house in a residential neighborhood in Southern Utah. Next, Tom is in Georgia where finds a 1965 Ford Fairlane with a 289 V-8 and 4-speed manual transmission.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Broncos, Galaxies and a lifted Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds all sorts of interesting vehicles on a trip to Northern Michigan, from Ford Broncos to a unique Ford Galaxie. Speaking of Galaxies, hang around for a look at a Galaxie 500 that is back on the road after being a "barn find" itself!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Bugatti EB110 and Volkswagen XL1
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the Quad-Turbo, V-12 Bugatti EB110. Next, he dives into a car most people don't know exists: the Volkswagen XL1, a car capable of 250 miles per gallon.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Classic Toyotas!
programme.desc: In this episode, watch as Chip Foose draws his creative take on the legendary Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser.Next, Chip moves onto another Japanese classic from the same manufacturer, the iconic little sportscar: the Toyota MR2.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1000 HP Cars & The Most Versatile Barn Find Guest We've Ever Met
programme.desc: Join Tom as he tours Hayden's one-of-a-kind Speedshop.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tennessee barn finds: Chevys, Fords, Alfas, Fords and more
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to Tennessee where he finds a C2 Corvette and an Alfa Romeo Sprint along with a plethora of other Chevys, Fords and Mopars.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Subaru BRZ and Alfa Romeo SZ
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us why the new Subaru BRZ does NOT, in fact, need a turbo by comparing it to the Mazda MX-5 ND2 Miata. Next, Jason dives into the story behind one of the ugliest cars ever, the Alfa Romeo SZ

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Bentley Continental GT and Lamborghini Hurac叩n Tecnica Reviews

programme.title: RadVentures | V8 Audi Quattro rally car and a Nissan 240SX drift car

programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drive a Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, and a 2002 Porsche Boxster. Follow along as Magnus discovers whether or not these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some amazing barn finds in Detroit, MI, including a Buick Caballero, a pair of Pontiac GTOs and a pair of Jaguar XK140s. Next, we find Tom in Arizona where he uncovers some interesting Mopars and two Big-block Chevy Camaros.

programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a barn find motherlode! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies a rare Ferrari and a 427 Shelby Cobra that have been sitting for decades. This is the story of the find, removal, and auction of these amazing vehicles.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Buick Grand National and a restoration shop disaster
programme.desc: Tom Cotter starts off this episode finding a stash of cars that includes a 1984 Buick Grand National press car. After that, Tom visits the remains of an amazing Woodie restoration shop that burned completely to the ground.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tri-power Olds Super 88 and forgotten cars must GO!
programme.desc: Tom teams up with Davin Reckow, from our "Redline Rebuild" series, to unearth a large collection of forgotten classics, including an Oldsmobile Super 88 that gets a second lease on life after it's purchase and restored by a Barn Find Hunter viewer!

programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a tour of an enormous "museum" of forgotten cars stashed in a defunct car dealership. Tom's next stop reveals a rare Corvair, a large collection of Mazdas, and a rare "Alfa Jr."

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn find road trip in a restored Ford Country Squire wagon
programme.desc: After attempting to buff out a dusty fender on a junkyard Ford, Tom Cotter is inspired to clean up the whole car, get it running, and take it on a road trip from Texas to Kansas and find more barn finds along the way!

programme.title: The Huntsman
programme.desc: Join Chris Waters (The Huntsman) as he takes on a challenging fallow buck hunt in the rugged Central Highlands of New South Wales. With the rut over and the bucks wary after heavy hunting pressure, this isnt going to be easy. But with persistence, skill, and a bit of blood, sweat, and tears, Chris is determined to get the job done.This episode is packed with expert deer stalking, fast-paced shooting, and plenty of interesting insights about fallow deer. And of course, no hunt is complete without harvesting clean, wild meat straight from the field. If you love fair-chase hunting, action-packed stalks, and good food, this ones for you!

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Join me for an exclusive interview with Coach HP as we embark on an incredible journey with a true sports aficionado. Born in Cuba and driven by an unwavering passion for baseball, Coach HP's life story is a remarkable odyssey from Miami to Los Angeles and beyond.Growing up under the guidance of a strict yet devoted father, he imbibed the value of hard work, a cornerstone of his extraordinary success today. After his baseball days in high school and college, Coach HP headed to the West Coast, where he explored a world beyond the diamond.His path is marked by intriguing twists, including influential roles in entertainment and nightlife, as well as becoming a sought-after national speaker. Yet, at the core of it all, baseball has been his heart's true calling. In 2016, Coach HP returned to Miami with a fresh training approach that's revolutionizing the game. Join us for this enlightening conversation where we not only uncover the lessons learned in baseball but also gain insights into life's profound journey. It's a story of passion, hard work, and the relentless pursuit of excellence that you won't want to missPrepare to be inspired, entertained, and motivated. Don't miss this exclusive interview with Coach HP; hit that 'Subscribe' button, turn on notifications, and join us on this extraordinary adventure. Your path to greatness begins here!WEBSITES:http://www.saltwaterexperience.comhttp://www.tomrowlandpodcast.comSTREAM ALL OUR FULL SEASONS ON WAYPOINT TV: http://waypointtv.com/#!/saltwaterexperience

programme.desc: On opening day of Missouris gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the Show Me state in search of mature whitetail bucks. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in Americathe wild turkey breeding season. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country cant be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. programme.title: The Huntsman
programme.desc: Join Chris Waters (The Huntsman) as he takes on a challenging fallow buck hunt in the rugged Central Highlands of New South Wales. With the rut over and the bucks wary after heavy hunting pressure, this isnt going to be easy. But with persistence, skill, and a bit of blood, sweat, and tears, Chris is determined to get the job done.This episode is packed with expert deer stalking, fast-paced shooting, and plenty of interesting insights about fallow deer. And of course, no hunt is complete without harvesting clean, wild meat straight from the field. If you love fair-chase hunting, action-packed stalks, and good food, this ones for you!

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Join me for an exclusive interview with Coach HP as we embark on an incredible journey with a true sports aficionado. Born in Cuba and driven by an unwavering passion for baseball, Coach HP's life story is a remarkable odyssey from Miami to Los Angeles and beyond.Growing up under the guidance of a strict yet devoted father, he imbibed the value of hard work, a cornerstone of his extraordinary success today. After his baseball days in high school and college, Coach HP headed to the West Coast, where he explored a world beyond the diamond.His path is marked by intriguing twists, including influential roles in entertainment and nightlife, as well as becoming a sought-after national speaker. Yet, at the core of it all, baseball has been his heart's true calling. In 2016, Coach HP returned to Miami with a fresh training approach that's revolutionizing the game. Join us for this enlightening conversation where we not only uncover the lessons learned in baseball but also gain insights into life's profound journey. It's a story of passion, hard work, and the relentless pursuit of excellence that you won't want to missPrepare to be inspired, entertained, and motivated. Don't miss this exclusive interview with Coach HP; hit that 'Subscribe' button, turn on notifications, and join us on this extraordinary adventure. Along with detective Candy Bliss (Whoopi Goldberg), the family must relive their trauma and find out the truth about Sam.

programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers whove been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: The Undercover Man
programme.desc: Determined Treasury Department investigator Frank Warren (Glenn Ford) goes after a ruthless mobster known as The Big Fellow. When a key informant is murdered, Warren pursues the gangster on charges of tax evasion. But, with a slick mob lawyer hampering him at every turn, and threats being lobbed toward Warren's wife (Nina Foch), the lawman's chances of achieving a conviction are slim to none. His only hope is that one syndicate bookkeeper will have the courage to turn state's evidence.

programme.title: Our Wife
programme.desc: A composer (Melvyn Douglas) goes on a cruise and meets a woman (Ruth Hussey) he likes more than his wife (Ellen Drew).

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: Theodora Goes Wild
programme.desc: Theodora Lynn (Irene Dunne) is secretly the author of a salacious novel written under a pen name. She must hide her identity from the residents of her small, conservative Connecticut town, who disapprove of the book. When Theodora goes to New York to visit her publisher (Thurston Hall), she meets the book's cover artist, Michael Grant (Melvyn Douglas), who tries to convince her to reveal herself as the real author. When Theodora falls for Michael, she soon finds that he has secrets of his own.

programme.title: You Can't Take It With You
programme.desc: Sweet-natured Alice Sycamore (Jean Arthur) falls for banker's son Tony Kirby (James Stewart). But when she invites her snooty prospective in-laws to dinner to give their blessing to the marriage, Alice's peculiar extended family -- including philosophical grandfather Martin Vanderhof (Lionel Barrymore), hapless fledgling ballerina sister Essie (Ann Miller) and fireworks enthusiast father, Paul (Samuel S. Hinds) -- might be too eccentric for the staid Kirbys.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: Girls Can Play
programme.desc: A detective investigates the murder of a player on a professional girl's softball team.

programme.title: The Admirable Crichton
programme.desc: A butler becomes a king after a shipwreck.

programme.title: Affair in Trinidad
programme.desc: At the cost of damaging her relationship, a club dancer secretly works in cahoots with the cops to extract intel from a gang of international spies.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: She Played With Fire
programme.desc: An English insurance man (Jack Hawkins) discovers his ex-girlfriend (Arlene Dahl) and her husband's (Dennis Price) art-forgery/arson scam.

programme.title: Gidget (1959)
programme.desc: Things turn around for a sad-faced teen who cant measure up to the chesty, bikini babes on the beach when two surfers start paying her attention.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: Texas Cyclone
programme.desc: A traveling cowboy visits an unusual town where everyone assumes he is a man who was once presumed to be dead, including the mans wife.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Two-Fisted Law
programme.desc: After Tim Clark's ranch is stolen by Bob Russell, he discovers that the crook is also trying to cheat his lover out of her land.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: The Texan Meets Calamity Jane
programme.desc: Calamity Jane's rightful ownership of a gambling hall is challenged but a Texas lawyer puts up a sensational legal battle to help her stay in charge.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: Ridin' for Justice
programme.desc: A popular cowboy (Buck Jones) takes the blame for the death of a deputy who tried to force himself on the marshal's wife.

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle
programme.desc: Ranchers and a new sheriff (Russell Hayden) have trouble with a gold rush.

programme.desc: Brazos Kane, a gunslinger who's vowed to kill no more, goes to work for a land baron on a ranch, where he is unjustly accused of murder.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.
